utils.elasticity package¶

Submodules¶

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils module¶

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.apply_zero_neumann_x_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces x component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in x direction.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – Network input

  • y (tensor) – Network output

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tx – x component of traction vector

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.apply_zero_neumann_y_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces y component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in y direction.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – Network input

  • y (tensor) – Network output

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Ty – y component of traction vector

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.apply_zero_neumann_z_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces z component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in z direction.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – Network input

  • y (tensor) – Network output

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tz – z component of traction vector

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.calculate_traction_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – Network input

  • y (tensor) – Network output

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tx, Ty, Tn, Tt – Traction components in cartesian (x,y) and polar coordinates (n (normal) and t (tangential))

Return type:

any

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.elastic_strain_2d(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the strain tensor components for plane stress condition in 2D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tf)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tf)) – contains the placeholder for network output

Returns:

sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy – contains the components of stress tensor

Return type:

Placeholder (tf)

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_plane_strain_stress_rate_coupling(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses based on linear isotropic material law and predicted displacements in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

term_xx, term_yy, term_zz, term_xy, term_yz, term_xz – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in 3D

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_2d_spacetime(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation. Note that this method works only if space-time domain (dde.geometry.GeometryXTime) is generated.

yPlaceholder (tensor)

contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy

Xnp array

Network input as numpy array (x,y,t)

Returns:

Tx, Ty, Tn, Tt – Traction components in cartesian (x,y) and polar coordinates (n (normal) and t (tangential))

Return type:

any

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_2d_time(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in 2D mixed formulation with time. Note that this method works only if the generated GMSH geometry is 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array (x,y,t)

Returns:

Tx, Ty, Tn, Tt – Traction components in cartesian (x,y) and polar coordinates (n (normal) and t (tangential))

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_3d(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – Network input

  • y (tensor) – Network output

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tx, Ty, Tz, Tn, Tt_1, Tt_2 – Traction components in cartesian (x,y) and polar coordinates (n (normal) and t (tangential))

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.get_tractions_mixed_3d_spacetime(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates traction components in the mixed formulation.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points an time: x, y, z, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array (x,y,z,t)

Returns:

Tx, Ty, Tz, Tn, Tt_1, Tt_2 – Traction components in cartesian (x,y,z) and polar coordinates (n (normal), t_1 (tangential 1), t_2 (tangential 2))

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.lin_iso_elasticity_plane_strain(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses based on linear isotropic material law and predicted displacements in plane strain condition.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments

  • y (tensor) – the network output

Returns:

term_x, term_y, term_xy – difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y and XY direction

Return type:

tensor

  • y (tensor) – the network output

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.momentum_2d_plane_stress(x, y)[source]¶
utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_3d(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for PDE of the mixed-variable formulation in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

momentum_x, momentum_y, momentum_z, term_xx, term_yy, term_zz, term_xy, term_yz, term_xz – momentum_x, momentum_y, momentum_z: momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses term_xx, term_yy, term_zz, term_xy, term_yz, term_xz: difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y, Z, XY, YZ, and XZ directions

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_3d_time(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for PDE of the mixed-variable formulation in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points an time: x, y, z, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

momentum_x, momentum_y, momentum_z, term_xx, term_yy, term_zz, term_xy, term_yz, term_xz – momentum_x, momentum_y, momentum_z: momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses term_xx, term_yy, term_zz, term_xy, term_yz, term_xz: difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y, Z, XY, YZ, and XZ directions

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_strain(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for pde of the mixed-variable formulation in case of plane strain

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments

  • y (tensor) – the network output

Returns:

momentum_x, momentum_y, term_x, term_y, term_xy – momentum_x, momentum_y: momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses term_x, term_y, term_xy: difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y and XY direction

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_strain_time_dependent(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and displacements. It generates the terms for pde of the displacement-stress mixed-variable formulation in case of plane strain for elastodynamics.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: c

Returns:

  • momentum_x, momentum_y, term_x, term_y, term_xy (tensor) – momentum_x, momentum_y: momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_x, term_y, term_xy (tensor) – Difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y and XY direction in case of plane strain

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_stress(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for pde of the mixed-variable formulation in case of plane stress

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments

  • y (tensor) – the network output

Returns:

momentum_x, momentum_y, term_x, term_y, term_xy – momentum_x, momentum_y: momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses term_x, term_y, term_xy: difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y and XY direction

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_plane_stress_time_dependent(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and displacements. It generates the terms for pde of the displacement-stress mixed-variable formulation in case of plane stress.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy

Returns:

  • momentum_x, momentum_y, term_x, term_y, term_xy (tensor) – momentum_x, momentum_y: momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_x, term_y, term_xy (tensor) – Difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y and XY direction in case of plane stress

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_velocity_3d_time(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and generates the terms for PDE of the mixed-variable formulation in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points an time: x, y, z, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, disp_z, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_yz, sigma_xz

Returns:

momentum_x, momentum_y, momentum_z, term_xx, term_yy, term_zz, term_xy, term_yz, term_xz – momentum_x, momentum_y, momentum_z: momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses term_xx, term_yy, term_zz, term_xy, term_yz, term_xz: difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y, Z, XY, YZ, and XZ directions

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.pde_mixed_velocity_plane_strain_time_dependent(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates the momentum equation using predicted stresses and velocity fields. It generates the terms for pde of the displacement-velocity mixed-variable formulation in case of plane strain for elastodynamics. Additionally, it couples the velocity fields with displacements.

Parameters:

  • x (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for coordinates of input points and time: x, y, t

  • y (Placeholder (tensor)) – contains the placeholder for network output: disp_x, disp_y, sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy, velocity_x, velocity_y

Returns:

  • momentum_x, momentum_y (tensor) – momentum terms based on derivatives of predicted stresses

  • term_x, term_y, term_xy (tensor) – Difference between predicted stresses and calculated stresses in X, Y and XY direction in case of plane strain

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.problem_parameters()[source]¶

Calculates the elastic properties for given Lame and shear modulus.

Returns:

  • nu (Float) – Poisson’s ratio

  • lame (Float) – Lame parameter

  • shear (Float) – Shear modulus

  • e_modul (Float) – Young’s modulus

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.stress_to_traction_2d(sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_xy, normals, cond)[source]¶

Calculates the traction components in cartesian (x,y) and polar coordinates (n (normal) and t (tangential)).

Parameters:

  • (any) (sigma_xy)

  • (any)

  • (any)

  • (vector) (normals)

  • (boolean) (cond)

Returns:

Tx, Ty, Tn, Tt – Traction components in cartesian (x,y) and polar coordinates (n (normal) and t (tangential))

Return type:

any

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.stress_to_traction_3d(sigma_xx, sigma_yy, sigma_zz, sigma_xy, sigma_xz, sigma_yz, normals, tangentials_1, tangentials_2, cond)[source]¶

Calculates the traction components in Cartesian (x, y, z) and polar coordinates (n and t) in 3D.

Parameters:

  • sigma_xx (any) – Stress component in the x direction

  • sigma_yy (any) – Stress component in the y direction

  • sigma_zz (any) – Stress component in the z direction

  • sigma_xy (any) – Shear stress component in the xy plane

  • sigma_xz (any) – Shear stress component in the xz plane

  • sigma_yz (any) – Shear stress component in the yz plane

  • normals (numpy.ndarray) – Normal vectors

  • tangentials_1 (numpy.ndarray) – Tangential vectors in the first coordinate direction

  • tangentials_2 (numpy.ndarray) – Tangential vectors in the second coordinate direction

  • cond (boolean) – Dimensions of stresses and normals have to match. Normals are calculated on the boundary, while stresses are calculated everywhere.

Returns:

Tx, Ty, Tz, Tn, Tt_1, Tt_2 – Traction components in Cartesian (x, y, z) coordinates and in normal (n) and tangential directions (t_1, t_2)

Return type:

any

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.zero_neumann_x_mixed_formulation(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates/Enforces x component of traction vector in the mixed formulation. This is also known as zero Neumann boundary conditions in x direction.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – Network input

  • y (tensor) – Network output

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

Tx – x component of traction vector

Return type:

any

  • y (tensor) – Network output

  • X (np array) – Network input as numpy array

Returns:

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.zero_neumman_plane_strain_x(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates x component of the homogeneous Neumann BC

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

sigma_xx_n_x + sigma_xy_n_y – x component of the homogeneous Neumann BC

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.zero_neumman_plane_strain_y(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates y component of the homogeneous Neumann BC

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

sigma_yx_n_x + sigma_yy_n_y – y component of the homogeneous Neumann BC

Return type:

tensor

utils.elasticity.elasticity_utils.zero_neumman_plane_stress_x(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates x component of the homogeneous Neumann BC

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

sigma_xx_n_x + sigma_xy_n_y – x component of the homogeneous Neumann BC

Return type:

tensor

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)
